newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian coffee 96/97 crop estimated at 219,740 t.
newsitem.headline: Indian coffee 96/97 crop estimated at 219,740 t.

text.p: India's state-run Coffee Board has estimated the 1996/97 (October-September) crop at 219,740 tonnes against 223,000 a year ago.
The board, in figures released on Monday at an annual planters' conference, said the projected output comprises 97,565 tonnes of arabica and 122,175 tonnes of robusta.
The board estimated crop in the current year ending September 30 (today) at 223,000 tonnes made up of 103,250 tonnes of arabica and 119,750 tonnes of robusta.

Thee United Planters' Association of Southern India (UPASI), sponsers of the annual planters' conference, in a statement projected the 1996/97 coffee crop much lower at 180,000 tonnes equally divided between Arabica and Robusta.
UPASI estimated the 1995/96 crop at 200,000 tonnes comprising 95,000 tonnes of Arabica and 105,000 tonnes of Robusta.
